verses.verse: I saw when the Lamb broke one of the seals, and I heard, as if it were the sound of thunder, one of the four living creatures saying, "Come and see."
I saw and look, a white horse. He who sat on him had a bow, and a crown was granted to him. He went forth conquering and to conquer.
When he had broke the second seal, I heard the second living creature say, "Come and see."
And another horse went out [that was] red. Its rider was granted to remove peace from the earth, and that they should violently kill one another. There was also given to him a great sword.
When he had broke the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, "Come and see." So I looked and behold, a black horse. Its rider had a pair of balances in his hand.
Then I heard a voice among the four living creatures say, "A day's supply of wheat for a day's wages and three day's supply of barley for a day's wages, and do not bother the olive oil or the wine."
When he had broken the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature say, "Come and see."

I looked and lo, a pale colored horse, the rider's name was Death, and Hell accompanied him. Authority was granted to them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with the sword, with hunger, with death, and with the savage beasts of the earth.
When he had broken the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who were slaughtered because of the word of God and the testimony they had.
They shouted loudly with one voice, saying, "How long, O Lord, holy and true, how long before you judge and punish those on earth who shed our blood?"

White robes were given to every one of them, and it was said to them that they should rest for a little while longer until their fellow servants and also their brethren, who will be killed as they, will be completed.
And I looked when he broke the sixth seal and lo, there was a great earthquake, the sun became black as sackcloth [made] from hair, and the moon became like blood.
The stars of heaven fell to the earth, even as a fig tree drops her unripe figs when shaken by a strong wind.
Heaven vanished like a scroll when it is rolled up, and every mountain and island moved out of their location.
The kings of the earth, great men, rich men, military chiefs, the powerful, every slave and free man hid themselves in caves and under ledges in the mountains.
They spoke to the mountains and rocks, "Fall on us and hide us from the face of him who sits on the throne and from the Lamb's fierce anger,
because that day, that terrible day, is here, and who will be able to stand?"
